channel.title: Wade Allen on First Baptist Church Muncie
channel.description: Recent content in Wade Allen on First Baptist Church Muncie

item.title: Outward Appearances
item.description: We continue to work our way through Matthew’s gospel in this season of Epiphany.

item.title: Well Seasoned
item.description: In Matthew 5:13-16, Jesus challenges His followers to be salt and light.

item.title: Impacting Our World
item.description: Through the season of Epiphany, we have been moving together in the life of Jesus.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount
item.description: Jesus gathers his disciples on a mountainside to teach them about true happiness.

item.title: Blessed
item.description: I was greatly encouraged by the response on Sunday morning.

item.title: Leave Your Nets
item.description: In Matthew 4:12-23 Jesus leaves his hometown to begin his ministry.

item.title: Suprise Calling
item.description: I would like to thank Caleb Rolling for preaching this past weekend.

item.title: A Lesson in Humility
item.description: John the Baptist was deemed the greatest man every born by Jesus.

item.title: Baptism
item.description: As we continue to move through the season of Epiphany, we come to one of first stories recorded in Jesus’ adult life.

item.title: Way of the Wise Men
item.description: On this first Sunday of Epiphany, we consider the journey of the wise men.

item.title: Magi
item.description: I hope that you all had a wonderful new year.

item.title: Finishing Revelation
item.description: We come this Sunday to the final Sunday of Advent.

item.title: New Heaven and Earth
item.description: The final chapters of Revelation are extraordinary passages.

item.title: More Questions
item.description: We talked about the dynamic of Advent this past week in worship.

item.title: Advent Begins
item.description: Thanksgiving is a season of reflection.

item.title: Leaving a Legacy
item.description: I walk down the main hallway in our church several times each week.

item.title: Poetry
item.description: This coming Sunday, we will come together to Revelation 18.

item.title: Another Strange Image
item.description: This week’s imagery will be anything but boring.

item.title: Bowls Poured Out
item.description: As we read and study Revelation together, we might be struggling with the images.

item.title: Another Sign
item.description: As we continue in our Revelation study, we keep coming back to the same themes over and over.

item.title: Back to the Lamb
item.description: If you have not been with us the past few weeks, we have found ourselves deep in Revelation imagery.

item.title: Beasts
item.description: Our study in Revelation gives us more images each week.

item.title: More Strange Images
item.description: As we continue to venture through the book of Revelation, I hope that you are beginning to feel a bit more comfortable reading this often neglected book.

item.title: Puzzling Passage
item.description: This past Sunday, we crossed over the halfway mark in our series on the book of Revelation.

item.title: Moving Through the Story
item.description: The deeper we get into the story, the more intriguing it becomes.

item.title: More Terrifying Images
item.description: We find ourselves in interesting, yet terrifying section of the book of Revelation.

item.title: Silence in Heaven
item.description: It was wonderful to gather together this past Sunday in a combined service.

item.title: Marking His People
item.description: Sunday was the first time that I had ever preached on Revelation 6.

item.title: Opening the Seals
item.description: This past week’s passage (Revelation 5) was an easy passage to preach.

item.title: Who is Worthy?
item.description: We journeyed with John into God’s throne room this past Sunday.

item.title: Entering the Throne Room
item.description: For the last couple of weeks, we have been moving at neck break pace through the specific instructions to the seven churches (Revelation 2 and 3).

item.title: Three More Churches
item.description: We spent our time together yesterday in Revelation 2.

item.title: Comments to the Churches
item.description: I am grateful for the Joining God in the Neighborhood team who helped lead our worship yesterday.

item.title: John's Vision
item.description: It was a joy to gather together in a combined worship service yesterday.

item.title: New Study on Revelation
item.description: Just a quick note to remind you that we will be gathering in a combined worship service this week at 10:45 AM due to the holiday weekend.

item.title: Our Fathers
item.description: Pentecost Sunday was a fantastic day.

item.title: Holy Spirit
item.description: This past Sunday, we discussed the implications of Jesus’ ascension.

item.title: Ascension Sunday
item.description: As we continue to make our way to Pentecost Sunday (June 9), we come this week to Ascension Sunday (June 2).

item.title: Appearing to the Disciples
item.description: During this Easter season, we have discussed several of the resurrection appearances of Jesus.

item.title: Surprised on the Road
item.description: This week’s story is one of my favorite in all of Scripture.

item.title: The Original Mom
item.description: Just in case you need a reminder, Sunday is Mother’s Day.

item.title: Letting Go
item.description: As we move through the Easter season, we will find ourselves moving from story to story.

item.title: Finishing Matthew
item.description: One of the most familiar passages in all of the New Testament is Matthew 28:16-20.

item.title: Resurrection Sunday
item.description: It was wonderful to gather together this past Sunday.

item.title: Entry into Jerusalem
item.description: As we move toward Easter, we will gather together this Sunday for a combined worship service.

item.title: Returning Owner
item.description: We had a wonderful trip to visit our daughter last week.

item.title: Fairness
item.description: Have you ever been in line in the grocery store when a new lane is suddenly opened up?

item.title: Veering
item.description: We have been faithful in sticking to the prescribed passages in the Narrative Lectionary since September.

item.title: Flipping It Around
item.description: As we enter into the season of Lent, we continue in the Gospel of Matthew.

item.title: Transfigured
item.description: As we are moving toward Easter, we are a bit later this year.

item.title: Mass Feeding
item.description: Walking through Jesus’ ministry is both gratifying and challenging.

item.title: Digging Deeper
item.description: How many times do you you sit through a church service or sermon, walk away unable to recall the topic?

item.title: Eye Condition
item.description: Each week, I spend time in commentaries reading the experts in the field of bible research.

item.title: Heart Direction
item.description: For the next several weeks, we will be looking at the teachings of Jesus from Matthew.

item.title: Sharing Our Stories
item.description: A few months ago, Julie Davis asked me if she could meet to talk about something that God had placed on her heart.

item.title: Baptism
item.description: This past Sunday, we began the season of Epiphany with the story of the Magi.

item.title: Joseph
item.description: With only one more Sunday left in Advent, we are quickly making our way toward Christmas.

item.title: Fulfilling the Prophets
item.description: It was really cool to see so many participate in the response time yesterday in worship.

item.title: Risking It All
item.description: Last week’s sermon was an especially unique sermon for me (in terms of preparation).

item.title: Questioning God
item.description: As we transition from the Thanksgiving season to the Advent season, we continue to explore the prophets.

item.title: Coming to Church
item.description: We have been in the prophets for the past few weeks.

item.title: Odds Against Him
item.description: Sunday is going to be a fantastic day!

item.title: The Message of Micah
item.description: We stepped into the era of the prophets last week in our study of Naaman and Elisha.

item.title: Unlikely Characters
item.description: Over the next several weeks, we will be moving into stories that are a bit less familiar.

item.title: Whatever You Want
item.description: This past Sunday, we discussed the life of David.

item.title: David
item.description: I would like to thank Bill Eidson for preaching last week as we were on vacation.

item.title: Authentic Freedom
item.description: This past Sunday, we recounted the rescue of God’s people from the grips of Egyptian slavery.

item.title: Losing Faith
item.description: Last Sunday’s story was intriguing. Joseph resisting Potiphar’s wife and winding up in prison certainly reminds us that life is not always fair.

item.title: It's Not Fair
item.description: As we continue to move through the story of God, we come this week to Abraham’s great-grandson, Joseph.

item.title: Stepping Out in Faith
item.description: I found it ironic that we talked about Noah yesterday.

item.title: The Flood
item.description: We begin a new pattern this week in worship.

item.title: Cosmic Battle
item.description: It was wonderful to celebrate with you this past weekend.

item.title: Remembering
item.description: It is hard to believe that we have been in Muncie for a decade now.

item.title: Spirit-prompted Gifts
item.description: We continue to study the Holy Spirit this week in worship.

item.title: New Birth
item.description: I have really enjoyed the last few weeks in our study of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Woman at the Well
item.description: This Sunday, we come to week three in our series on the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Purpose and Mission of the Holy Spirit
item.description: We began our sermon series on the Holy Spirit this week.

item.title: Prevalence of the Holy Spirit
item.description: We begin a new sermon series on Sunday.

item.title: Loving One Another
item.description: I hope that everyone had a safe and relaxing Fourth of July week.

item.title: Light
item.description: Yesterday, I asked the congregation in both services if there was a word that came to mind when they thought of 1 John.

item.title: New Series
item.description: I hope that you enjoyed our recent series over the Ten Commandments.

item.title: To Covet
item.description: This has been an intriguing study over the Ten Commandments.

item.title: Relating to One Another
item.description: This past Sunday, we continued our study on the Ten Commandments.

item.title: First Table
item.description: This past Sunday, we began our series on the Ten Commandments.

item.title: New Series
item.description: I would like to thank Troy Hershman for preaching this past Sunday.

item.title: Ascension Sunday
item.description: We are quickly making our way through the 50 days of Easter.

item.title: Prayer for Us
item.description: We continue to work through a series on the post resurrection appearances of Jesus.

item.title: Surprise Visit
item.description: For the last several weeks, we have been talking about the post-resurrection appearances of Jesus.

item.title: Fish Breakfast
item.description: I have enjoyed working through this series on the post-resurrection appearances.

item.title: Emmaus Road
item.description: The Easter season is a wonderful season; it actually goes from Resurrection Sunday to Pentecost Sunday (50 days later).

item.title: Doubt
item.description: This past Sunday was a wonderful day.

item.title: The Passion of Christ
item.description: This past Sunday, we explored what scholars call the Olivet Discourse in Mark 13.

item.title: Farewell
item.description: It was wonderful to have Wilisha preaching at First Baptist yesterday.

item.title: Seeing Jesus
item.description: As we continue through the season of Lent, we are walking through the Jesus story together.

item.title: Lent
item.description: This coming Sunday is the first Sunday in the season of Lent.

item.title: More Miracles
item.description: We have heard the stories of Jesus over and over.

item.title: Proving His Identity
item.description: Throughout this series on the gospel of Mark, we keep coming back to Mark’s main point about Jesus.

item.title: Sowing Seed
item.description: We continue our Mark series this week by moving ahead into Mark 3:13-4:34.

item.title: Growing Opposition
item.description: Venturing through Mark has been fun so far.

item.title: Beginning Mark
item.description: The new year is an exciting time.

item.title: Dealing with Fear
item.description: As we come to this last week of 2017, we consider the year behind us.

item.title: Christmas Eve
item.description: Christmas is only a week away.

item.title: Two Weeks Away
item.description: The season of Advent is moving along; we are only two weeks from Christmas Day.

item.title: Christmas is Coming
item.description: The season of Advent is a special season.

item.title: Advent Begins
item.description: With Thanksgiving and Black Friday in the past, Christmas seems only a short time away.

item.title: Final Greetings
item.description: We come this week to our final study in Peter’s first epistle.

item.title: Harvest Sunday
item.description: We will gather in a combined service this Sunday, November 19 at 10:45 AM.

item.title: Rejoice in Suffering
item.description: This week, in our study over 1 Peter, we will continue to explore the issue of suffering.

item.title: Life Change
item.description: We find ourselves this week in the seventh sermon in 1 Peter.

item.title: Special Sunday
item.description: Just a quick reminder that we will be gathering in one combined service this Sunday (October 29) at 10:45 AM.

item.title: Five Adjectives
item.description: Throughout our series on 1 Peter, we have discussed the changing dynamics of our world.

item.title: Household Instructions
item.description: We come, this week, to a passage in 1 Peter that might seem disconnected from the other texts.

item.title: Two Hard Words
item.description: For the past several weeks, we have been discussing the dynamics of our changing culture.

item.title: Lasting Impact
item.description: This series in 1 Peter has been a rich and applicable study.

item.title: Living Holy Lives
item.description: This past Sunday, we began our 11-week study in 1 Peter.

item.title: Back
item.description: It is nice to be back.

item.title: Children
item.description: For the past few weeks, we have been talking about our mission as a church.

item.title: Impact vs. Presence
item.description: It has been good to spend time on our focus words during this season of sabbatical preparation.

item.title: Community
item.description: For several months now, we have been planning the upcoming summer.

item.title: Exploring Our Mission
item.description: It was wonderful to worship together on Sunday; Easter is certainly a high point on the church calendar.

item.title: Moving Toward Easter
item.description: This is perhaps the most significant week on the church calendar.

item.title: Holy Week
item.description: As we make our way toward Easter, we have been walking with Jesus through various aspects of His ministry.

item.title: Paramount Story
item.description: As we continue to journey through the season of Lent, we come this week to a paramount story in the life and ministry of Jesus.

item.title: Another Intriguing Conversation
item.description: It is fun to read about Jesus’ conversations with those who are trying to figure Him out.

item.title: The Starting Point
item.description: Jesus encounters a religious leader named Nicodemus in John 3:1-16.

item.title: Born Again
item.description: We come this week to John 3:1-17.

item.title: Trials in the Wilderness
item.description: As we enter the season of Lent, we explore the temptations of Jesus in the desert.

item.description: This Sunday marks the first Sunday in the season of Lent.

item.title: Manifestation of Glory
item.description: The season of Epiphany ends with the story of the Transfiguration.

item.title: Supernatural Encounter
item.description: As we venture through Epiphany, we come to the final Sunday of the season.

item.title: The Power of Love
item.description: As we continue to study the Sermon on the Mount, we come to the difficult passage of Matthew 5:38-48.

item.title: Heart Exam
item.description: In the season of Valentine’s Day, we think a lot about hearts.

item.title: Hard Teaching
item.description: We have been walking through Matthew 5 for the last several weeks.

item.title: Salt and Light Living
item.description: In Matthew 5:13-16, Jesus challenges His followers to be salt and light.

item.title: Salt and Light
item.description: Last week, we considered what some call The Beatitudes or blessings found in Matthew 5.

item.title: The Beatitudes
item.description: Jesus gathers his disciples on a mountainside to teach them about true happiness.

item.title: Famous Sermon
item.description: As we continue through the season of Epiphany, we come to one of Jesus’ more famous sermons in Matthew 5.

item.title: Follow
item.description: In Matthew 4:12-23 Jesus leaves his hometown to begin his ministry.

item.title: Following Jesus
item.description: To be a follower is often seen in a negative light.

item.title: Baptism
item.description: John the Baptist was deemed the greatest man every born by Jesus.

item.title: Detering Jesus
item.description: As we begin a new year, we often think of new tasks or habits for our lives.

item.title: The Greatest Gift
item.description: On Christmas morning we gather to reflect on the one true gift, Jesus.

item.title: Christmas Services
item.description: Throughout the season of Advent, we have been anticipating the coming of Jesus, the coming of Christmas.

item.title: Patience
item.description: On this final Sunday of Advent, we consider the value of patience.

item.title: Waiting
item.description: It is fun to look at the Advent/Christmas season through the eyes of children.

item.title: The Gift
item.description: On this third Sunday of Advent, we explore the first few verses of Paul’s letter to the Romans.

item.title: Gift
item.description: The season of Advent is a season of anticipation.

item.title: Word of God
item.description: As we come to this second Sunday of Advent, Paul reminds us of the power of Scripture.

item.title: The Word of God
item.description: As we step into the season of Advent, we have been encouraged to wake up to all that God is doing our world.

item.title: Wake Up
item.description: On the first Sunday of Advent, we consider Paul’s words to the Romans.

item.title: Be Ready
item.description: As we approach the Thanksgiving holiday we are reminded that Christmas is just around the corner.

item.title: A Thankful Heart
item.description: The psalmist in chapter 107 instructs the reader to thank God for his intense love and marvelous deeds.

item.title: Gratitude
item.description: This week, we gather for our annual Harvest Sunday.

item.title: Friendship
item.description: Friendship can be a complex yet invigorating gift.

item.title: Friends
item.description: We come this week to our last sermon in our series on the book of Proverbs.

item.title: Money
item.description: The bible has a surprising amount to say about money.

item.title: Awkward Subject
item.description: Money can be an awkward topic.

item.title: Anger
item.description: Solomon has a lot to say about anger.

item.title: Anger
item.description: Do you struggle with a bad temper?

item.title: Wise Words
item.description: Proverbs has more to say about our words than any other topic.

item.title: Power of Words
item.description: The later two thirds of the book of Proverbs cover a variety of topics.

item.title: Wisdom Living
item.description: We sometimes wonder if wisdom is a big deal?

item.title: Significance of Wisdom
item.description: We have been talking a lot about wisdom over the last few weeks.

item.title: Plenty and Pain
item.description: This short text provides powerful application in our relationship with God.

item.title: Plenty and Pain
item.description: This past week, we talked about trusting God.

item.title: Trust
item.description: Solomon describes a life of wisdom.

item.title: Letting Go
item.description: In our text this week, we have a very familiar passage of Scripture.

item.title: Growing God's Way
item.description: In the second chapter of Proverbs, we are encouraged to actively seek wisdom from the Lord.

item.title: Pursing Wisdom
item.description: Our journey through Proverbs has been a little slow.

item.title: An Urgent Appeal
item.description: Wisdom cries out in the streets in Proverbs 1:20-33.

item.title: False Freedom
item.description: Have you ever dreamed of dropping it all and taking off?

item.title: A Trap
item.description: We are living in a world of increasing violence and turmoil.

item.title: Dangerous Path
item.description: Yesterday, we kicked off our series on the book of Proverbs.

item.title: The Way of Wisdom
item.description: As we begin a series on the book of Proverbs, we find that wisdom is available for each of us.

item.title: More than Smart
item.description: I conducted a funeral on Monday for a man I have never met.

item.title: Camp Barnabas Services
item.description: This week, the teenagers who served at Camp Barnabas will be presenting in both worship Services.

item.title: Judas Iscariot
item.description: Judas Iscariot is one of the most famous disciples but for all the wrong reasons.

item.title: Betrayal
item.description: We come to the end of our series on the disciples this week.

item.title: Three Lesser Known
item.description: The first three disciples in the final group are obscure; we know very little about them.

item.title: Obscurity
item.description: As I have studied the 12 disciples over the past several weeks, I have been surprised by the lack of information we have on many of them.

item.title: Thomas
item.description: We all think of Thomas as the doubter.

item.title: Transformation
item.description: A key theme in our series over the lives of the Twelve (disciples) is the transformation that occurs in their lives.

item.title: Matthew
item.description: Matthew is perhaps the most surprising disciple.

item.title: Sinners
item.description: Christy and I are with our teens at Camp Barnabas this week.

item.title: Philip
item.description: Philip was a by-the-book kind of person.

item.title: Beyond the Possible
item.description: As we continue our sermon series over the life of the 12 disciples, we begin our second group of 4 this week.

item.title: John
item.description: The apostle John is one of the most familiar of the twelve.

item.title: Learning from Jesus
item.description: As we continue our series on the 12 disciples, we are finding a common theme.

item.title: James
item.description: James, the brother of John, is described as zealous, passionate and even reckless.

item.title: The First to Die
item.description: This past Sunday, we talked about Peter’s brother, Andrew.

item.title: Andrew
item.description: Andrew is seldom mentioned in Scripture as compared to his famous brother, Peter.

item.title: Behind the Scenes
item.description: It was fun to talk about Peter in worship this past Sunday.

item.title: Peter
item.description: Peter is mentioned more in the gospels than any other person except Jesus.

item.title: The Leader
item.description: It is nearly impossible to recount all of Peter’s stories in the bible.

item.title: The Disciples
item.description: We will be spending most of the summer in a sermon series over Jesus’ twelve disciples.

item.title: New Series on the Twelve
item.description: I woke up this morning excited about this week’s sermon work.

item.title: The Descent
item.description: As we conclude the season of Easter, we consider what happens in Acts 2.

item.title: Redefining the Feast
item.description: This Sunday (May 15) is Pentecost Sunday, the celebration of what happens in Acts 2.

item.title: The Ascent
item.description: As we conclude the Gospel of Luke, we find the disciples witnessing the ascension of Jesus.

item.title: Leaving
item.description: It was great to hear from the founders of TreeFort Ministries yesterday in worship.

item.title: All Things New
item.description: The lectionary passage for the week takes us into the final book of the bible; we will only spend one week here.

item.title: The Ending of the Story
item.description: It was wonderful to join the Revolution in worship on Sunday.

item.title: Coming Together
item.description: For the past three weeks, we have been together in Luke 24.

item.title: Open Your Eyes
item.description: As we study the third encounter of the Risen Christ in Luke 24, we find a gathered group of faithless, fearful disciples.

item.title: Jesus Appears
item.description: For the past few weeks (and also this coming Sunday), we will be in Luke 24.

item.title: Recognizing Jesus
item.description: Luke 24 records three encounters. Last week, we studied the women at the tomb.

item.title: Easter Continues
item.description: As we move into April, many of us consider Easter over.

item.title: He Lives
item.description: In Luke’s account of the empty tomb, we find bewildered women making a trip to anoint Jesus’ body.

item.title: Risen
item.description: My kids have been on spring break this week.

item.title: Palm Sunday
item.description: Neil Kring, pastor of The Revolution Church in Muncie, is our guest speaker on this day.

item.title: The Barren Fig Tree
item.description: As Jesus encounters tragedy, he corrects the common understandings of his day.

item.title: Finger Pointing
item.description: Our world has had its share of tragedies in recent years.

item.title: Lost and Found
item.description: We often envision God as stern and demanding.

item.title: Lost
item.description: God’s Word is powerful. We learned last week about the importance of engaging God’s Word.

item.title: Healing Words
item.description: As Jesus and his companions descend from the Mount of Transfiguration, they are met by a crowd (the next day).

item.title: Contrast
item.description: As we journey together through the season of Lent, we walk with the disciples from one experience to another.

item.title: Temptation
item.description: Shortly after Jesus’s baptism, he travels into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

item.title: Facing the Devil
item.description: This week marks the beginning of the Lenten Season.

item.title: The Glory of God
item.description: The Transfiguration is a key event in the life and mission of Jesus.

item.title: Glory Revealed
item.description: This coming Sunday, February 7, is Transfiguration Sunday.

item.title: Follow
item.description: While Jesus is teaching on the shore of a lake, Simon and his companions are fishing with little success.

item.title: Follow Me
item.description: As we continue in the season of Epiphany, we are journeying with Jesus as he begins his ministry.

item.title: Rejected at Home
item.description: Jesus returns to his hometown as a Rabbi.

item.title: Hometown
item.description: A few years ago, I returned to my hometown to do a wedding for a cousin.

item.title: Baptism of Jesus
item.description: One of the first acts of Jesus’ ministry is his baptism.

item.title: Down by the River
item.description: On Sunday, we stepped into the season of Epiphany.

item.title: We Three Kings
item.description: The song Twelve Days of Christmas remind us that Christmas does not happen on one day.

item.title: Mary's Song
item.description: As we approach Christmas day, we are often overwhelmed with the stress of the holiday season.

item.title: Provision
item.description: As we come to the final Sunday in Advent, we will shift our study a bit closer to the Christmas story.

item.title: Re-Focus
item.description: Our lives are often overwhelmed by the anxiety of our current circumstances.

item.title: Anxiety
item.description: It is easy to be overwhelmed by the stress of life.

item.title: Expectant
item.description: Paul’s letter to the Philippians allows us to peer into his heart.

item.title: Return
item.description: Last Sunday, we talked about Jesus’ second coming.

item.title: Come Jesus Come
item.description: As we approach the season of Advent, we are reminded that it is a season of urgency and expectancy.

item.title: Anticipation
item.description: The Christmas season is underway. Starbucks now has red cups and the lamp posts in Muncie have lit stars hanging from them; we even had our first snowfall this past weekend.

item.title: Hypocrisy vs. Humility
item.description: We do not need to be good to be forgiven, we need to be honest about ourselves and repentant.

item.title: Surprise
item.description: The parables of Jesus are fascinating stories.

item.title: Dead Men Talking
item.description: Jesus tells a story (a parable) about a rich man and a poor man.

item.title: The Afterlife
item.description: Talk of post-life experiences seem to be flooding our media channels.

item.title: The One Talent Man
item.description: As we continue to study the parables of Jesus, we come to the story of the master who distributes talents to his servants and leaves town.

item.title: Slaves Made Children
item.description: I have enjoyed revisiting the parables over the last couple of weeks.

item.title: Forgiven To Forgive
item.description: Peter asks Jesus an honest question.

item.title: Honest Question
item.description: The disciples sometimes seem clueless in the Gospel accounts.

item.title: Parable of the Soil
item.description: As we engage our first parable in our five week series on parables, we come to the parable of the soil.

item.title: Scattered Seed
item.description: I am excited about our next sermon series.

item.title: Faith in Action
item.description: As we step into our Fall Reach week, we will begin by reflecting on James’ challenge to action.

item.title: Action
item.description: It has been a joy to journey with you through the life of Solomon.

item.title: Defiance or Repentance
item.description: As we explore 1 Kings 11:14-43, we find Solomon in the wake of God’s judgment.

item.title: Solomon's Final Response
item.description: It was nice to gather together in a combined service on Sunday.

item.title: Legacy Sunday
item.description: On Sunday, September 27, we gathered in a combined service.

item.title: Turning Away
item.description: For several weeks, we have been aware of a dark cloud in the story of Solomon.

item.title: God's Patience
item.description: Solomon’s story is one of ups and downs.

item.title: The Queen of Sheba
item.description: In 1 Kings 10, we explore one of the most intriguing stories in world history.

item.title: A Dark Cloud
item.description: In 1 Kings 9:10-25, a dark cloud looms over Solomon’s kingdom.

item.title: A Queen's Visit
item.description: The time is closing on our completion of the Solomon series; we have four more weeks.

item.title: The Wrong Road

item.description: When we lived in Springfield, Illinois, a friend (and member of our church) worked on the Governor’s staff.

item.title: Reliance
item.description: In our culture, we are often told that we can accomplish whatever we want.

item.title: Disappointed
item.description: I don’t know about you, but I hate going to the grocery store on my way home from work.

item.title: Joseph
item.description: You don’t have to go to church to know story of Joseph.

item.title: Struggle
item.description: Jacob’s story is quite remarkable. As a baby coming out of his mothers womb, he is grabbing the heel of his brother.

item.title: Tables Turned
item.description: God’s story is anything but boring.

item.title: God's Timetable
item.description: A few weeks ago, I was working on this Sunday’s sermon.

item.title: Seeking God's Direction
item.description: As we step into the month of August, we are nearing the one year mark of our discernment process regarding church staffing.

item.title: Listening to God
item.description: Have you ever been asked to pull off the impossible?

item.title: Laughter
item.description: Laughter is a good thing, right?

item.title: Following God's Way
item.description: We talked this week about what it means to follow God’s leading into the unknown.

item.title: Stepping Out
item.description: It was four years ago this summer that our family responded to a call to pastor this church.

item.title: Fathers
item.description: Have you ever been asked to read Scripture in a small group Bible study.

item.title: Tall Buildings
item.description: We spent this past weekend in Chicago; my kids wanted to ride the Ferris wheel on Navy Pier at night.

item.title: Search Team Update
item.description: As we move past Memorial Day, the swimming pools open and the kids get out of school; summer is here.

item.title: God Regretting
item.description: On June 3, I will be in Chicago for graduation; Matt will be preaching.

item.title: Evil Within
item.description: Erik Larson’s 2003 New York Times best seller The Devil in the White City highlights the story of two men.

item.title: The Gift of Women
item.description: This coming Sunday is Mother’s Day.

item.title: Paradise
item.description: We were certainly given a break this winter in Indiana; the weather was much milder than usual.

item.title: Change 2
item.description: We have lived two Sundays in the new schedule.

item.title: Rest
item.description: Have you ever attended a lock-in?

item.title: Change
item.description: John Lasseter of Pixar Studios was being interviewed by Michelle Norris on National Public Radio.

item.title: Victory
item.description: I am going to do something this Easter that I don’t think I have ever done; I am going to be preaching from a psalm.

item.title: In Your Hands
item.description: This Sunday is the last Sunday of Lent; we begin Holy Week.

item.title: Genesis Series
item.description: I have enjoyed time in the Psalms through the Lenten season.

item.title: Schedule Change
item.description: In just a few weeks, we will be transitioning to a new Sunday morning schedule.

item.title: Repenting
item.description: We live in a world of excuses.

item.title: Giving Thanks
item.description: Have you ever been in a place where you needed rescued?

item.title: Creation Psalm
item.description: It has been fun studying the Psalms for the past couple of weeks.

item.title: Reminded Psalms
item.description: Are you a forgetful person? I have to write everything down in order to remember.

item.title: Trust Psalm 25
item.description: I am pleased with our recent mission series.

item.title: Discerning Schedule Change
item.description: In November, we began a discernment process to determine if we should alter our Sunday morning schedule.

item.title: Beyond Us
item.description: If you have not been at church for past few weeks, you are going to be pleasantly surprised when you walk down the main hallway.

item.title: Offering Ourselves
item.description: To say that the Holy Spirit is involved in our worship planning is a no brainer.

item.title: Empowering
item.description: I have enjoyed the first two weeks of our mission statement series.

item.title: Sick Day
item.description: This past weekend was a difficult weekend for me.

item.title: Coming Together
item.description: We just returned from a great weekend in Wisconsin with the teenagers; it was a great time to connect with them.

item.title: Responding to the King
item.description: I am sitting in South Georgia on New Year’s Day reviewing next week’s sermon.

item.title: Christmas Worship
item.description: With Christmas less than one week away, we are preparing for two special worship services this weekend.

item.title: January Sermon Series
item.description: It may seem strange to get a newsletter for January before Christmas.

item.title: Faithful God
item.description: This week, we gather in one combined service to celebrate the coming of Christmas through music.

item.title: Fulfilling the Prophets
item.description: We have been talking about the prophets predictions of Jesus coming this Advent season.

item.title: Anticipation
item.description: This past Sunday, we entered into the season of Advent.
